unnormalised: **Key Indian Festivals Scheduled for the Remainder of 2024**
normalised: **Key Indian Festivals Scheduled for the Remainder of two thousand and twenty four**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The Ministry of Culture has released a tentative schedule outlining key festivals to be celebrated across India for the balance of 2024. This announcement serves to provide both domestic and international tourists with ample opportunity to plan their travels and participate in the rich cultural tapestry that India offers.
normalised: New Delhi – The Ministry of Culture has released a tentative schedule outlining key festivals to be celebrated across India for the balance of two thousand and twenty four. This announcement serves to provide both domestic and international tourists with ample opportunity to plan their travels and participate in the rich cultural tapestry that India offers.

unnormalised: Among the festivals highlighted, Ganesh Chaturthi is slated for 07/09/2024, a celebration particularly vibrant in Maharashtra. Devotees across the nation will observe this with processions and elaborate displays, culminating in the immersion of idols in water bodies. Government guidelines regarding eco-friendly celebrations are expected to be reiterated closer to the date.
normalised: Among the festivals highlighted, Ganesh Chaturthi is slated for seventh september two thousand and twenty four, a celebration particularly vibrant in Maharashtra. Devotees across the nation will observe this with processions and elaborate displays, culminating in the immersion of idols in water bodies. Government guidelines regarding eco-friendly celebrations are expected to be reiterated closer to the date.

unnormalised: Navratri, a nine-night festival dedicated to the worship of the divine feminine, is expected to commence on 03/10/2024. Different regions of India celebrate Navratri with varying traditions, ranging from the 'Garba' dance in Gujarat to the 'Durga Puja' celebrations in West Bengal. Elaborate pandals and cultural events are a common sight during this period. The festival will conclude on 12/10/2024, with Vijayadashami, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil.
normalised: Navratri, a nine-night festival dedicated to the worship of the divine feminine, is expected to commence on third october two thousand and twenty four. Different regions of India celebrate Navratri with varying traditions, ranging from the 'Garba' dance in Gujarat to the 'Durga Puja' celebrations in West Bengal. Elaborate pandals and cultural events are a common sight during this period. The festival will conclude on twelfth october two thousand and twenty four, with Vijayadashami, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil.

unnormalised: Dussehra, occurring on 12/10/2024, coincides with the final day of Navratri and is marked by the burning of effigies of Ravana, symbolizing the victory of Lord Rama. Preparations for large-scale celebrations are already underway in several states, including Uttar Pradesh and Karnataka.
normalised: Dussehra, occurring on twelfth october two thousand and twenty four, coincides with the final day of Navratri and is marked by the burning of effigies of Ravana, symbolizing the victory of Lord Rama. Preparations for large-scale celebrations are already underway in several states, including Uttar Pradesh and Karnataka.

unnormalised: Diwali, the festival of lights, is projected to occur on 31/10/2024. Homes and businesses will be illuminated with diyas and lights, accompanied by prayers and the exchange of sweets. Air quality regulations concerning firecrackers are expected to be enforced rigorously across major metropolitan areas, especially in Delhi NCR. The holiday season surrounding Diwali typically sees a surge in travel and commercial activity.
normalised: Diwali, the festival of lights, is projected to occur on thirty first october two thousand and twenty four. Homes and businesses will be illuminated with diyas and lights, accompanied by prayers and the exchange of sweets. Air quality regulations concerning firecrackers are expected to be enforced rigorously across major metropolitan areas, especially in Delhi N-C-R. The holiday season surrounding Diwali typically sees a surge in travel and commercial activity.

unnormalised: Guru Nanak Jayanti, the birth anniversary of the first Sikh Guru, is anticipated to fall on 15/11/2024. Sikh communities across India and worldwide will commemorate this day with prayers, processions, and charitable activities. Gurdwaras will host special programs and langars (community kitchens) open to all.
normalised: Guru Nanak Jayanti, the birth anniversary of the first Sikh Guru, is anticipated to fall on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four. Sikh communities across India and worldwide will commemorate this day with prayers, processions, and charitable activities. Gurdwaras will host special programs and langars (community kitchens) open to all.

unnormalised: Christmas Day, celebrated on 25/12/2024, will be observed by Christian communities throughout the country, marked with church services, carol singing, and festive gatherings. Goa and Kerala, known for their significant Christian populations, will see particularly vibrant celebrations.

unnormalised: The Ministry urges citizens to observe these festivals with reverence and respect for local customs. Further announcements and detailed schedules will be released in the coming months. The information is current as of 17/06/2024.
